intro: Pedicularis cyathophylloides, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that resemble the face of a monkey, hence its common name. It typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. The leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and branched.
